intro: Triplaris guayaquilensis, commonly known as the Guayaquil triplaris, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rhamnaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Ecuador and Colombia. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, yellowish-green flowers that appear in clusters. It thrives in humid, tropical environments and is often found in lowland forests. The fruit is a small, fleshy drupe that contains a single seed.
